node.title: Missing her home in Afghanistan, Rabiha found a new one at a local library
node.description: Rabiha felt lonely in her new home on the other side of the world, until she discovered the magic of stories and learned how to create a community.
node.content:
["Four years ago, 13-year-old Rabiha, her mum and four siblings landed at Melbourne airport.", "They had spent three days in transit, fleeing\u00a0Afghanistan.", "Meeting them at the airport was Rabiha's father, who they were reuniting with for the first time in five years.", "On the one hand, she was thrilled to see her father again. On the other, the prospect of beginning a new life was daunting.", "\"I was excited because I was seeing my father for the first time in five years,\" Rabiha, now 17\u00a0years old, says.", "\"[But] I had nothing but a few suitcases and my family around me \u2026 I had never felt so hopeless and lonely before.\"", "
A new home
", "The family settled in the south-eastern suburb of Dandenong, a place bursting with cultures from all over the world.", "Having seen people from all walks of life as the family settled into Dandenong, Rabiha woke up brimming with excitement when her first day of school arrived.", "She was full of confidence and optimism, she says.", "However, it was much more difficult than she'd anticipated.", "\"I could not understand anyone, they could not understand me, and I lost confidence. I tried to be friends with other people, but language was a barrier,\" she says.", "\"I missed all of my friends, my books, my school, my teachers, even the streets to my school in Afghanistan.\"", "Seeing Rabiha regress, her father intervened.", "He knew she loved to read, so he took her to the local library where Rabiha could work on her English through books.", "", "
Rabiha used books to learn English \u2014 progressing from kindergarten-level stories to young adult novels.(ABC News: Swathi\u00a0Shanmukhasundaram)
", "\"I learned English by reading children's books, working my way up to novels and became confident as I practised talking to people,\" she says.", "Rabiha also found a new sense of belonging among\u00a0the pages.", "\"The library was full of all kinds of people and there were so many kinds of books from all over the world in so many languages,\" Rabiha says.", "", "
Rabiha is now a regular at the Dandenong library.(ABC News: Swathi\u00a0Shanmukhasundaram)
", "As her English improved, her father continued to push Rabiha into social situations to work her confidence back up.", "\"We went to the doctor and my dad told me to talk to the receptionist. He said, 'It's OK\u00a0if you make mistakes. You can try again and ask them to clarify. You can do it,\" Rabiha recalls.", "\"I went to the receptionist and said, 'Here we are for our appointment' with full confidence!\"", "With new skills under her belt and her confidence nurtured, Rabiha once again turned her focus to making friends.", "And she finally got what she was so hoping for back on that first day of school.", "
A chance encounter
", "One day, Rabiha was searching for a book in the Dandenong Library when she spotted a familiar face.", "A girl she recognised from school was perusing the shelves.", "Rabiha approached her and struck up a conversation.", "\"We talked for a very long time,\" Rabiha says.", "\"We bonded over liking to read and write, and coming from a diverse background and loving Dandenong Library.\"", "That conversation sparked a friendship that has lasted years.", "\"Now we are best friends,\" Rabiha says.", "\"We do things together \u2014 go out, read, write (even at school), attend leadership programs, library events and all the school events.\"", "Rabiha has continued to forge connections and now has a tight circle of friends who come from places all over the world.", "", "
Rabiha now has a loving community around her.(ABC News: Swathi\u00a0Shanmukhasundaram)
", "She says having close relationships with people who also know what it is like to make a new home in Australia brings an extra level of understanding to the friendships.", "\"It really gives that extra dimension to it where we always have time for each other. We can always talk to each other,\" Rabiha says.", "Having built a supportive community around her, Rabiha says she is grateful to her parents for their continued support.", "\"Both my parents supported me so much\u00a0to be the best version of myself,\" she says.", "Rabiha now has hope for her future, dreaming\u00a0of one day pursuing a career in medicine."]
